meta.message: Potential causes for endometriosis identified based on user profile.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Monitoring hormonal health and consulting a healthcare provider
potential_causes.explanation_localized: At age 50, hormonal fluctuations, especially menopause, can influence endometriosis symptoms or related issues.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Incorporating stress-reduction techniques and relaxation practices
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Stress can impact hormonal regulation and exacerbate endometrial tissue irritations or pain.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Adopting an anti-inflammatory diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and omega-3s
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Diet can influence inflammation levels, which may impact endometriosis symptoms and overall pelvic health.

potential_causes.name_localized: Sedentary lifestyle and physical activity levels
potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Regular gentle exercise to promote healthy circulation and reduce discomfort
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Lack of activity can contribute to pelvic congestion and discomfort linked with endometriosis.

potential_causes.name_localized: Sleep disturbances or poor sleep hygiene
potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Improving sleep routines and creating a restful environment
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Sleep quality affects hormone regulation and pain perception, influencing endometriosis symptoms.

potential_causes.name_localized: Environmental factors such as exposure to endocrine disruptors
potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Reducing exposure to plastics, pesticides, and chemicals in daily products
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Certain environmental chemicals can interfere with hormonal balance and potentially influence endometriosis.
